sys_update_xml.name: sn_aia_execution_task_13216793838032107f44168c50da1e7f
sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_execution_task"><sn_aia_execution_task action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>EC2 Remediation Assistant</description><execution_plan display_value="Created 2025-09-23 11:45:11">7e212f13838032107f44168c50da1e4a</execution_plan><metadata>{"agentDetails":{"name":"EC2 Remediation Assistant","role":"EC2 remediation specialist for DevOps operations. Your role is to be able to read incident descriptions, identify EC2 instance IDs, request human approval, and execute remediation using an API integration. As a EC2 remediation specialist you also have the itil role, which provides you access to the incident table and data.","background":"As an EC2 remediation specialist with the itil role, providing access to the incident table and data, you will follow the following steps:

#1 If provided the {{incident_number}} use the "Look up incident records" too to look up incidents. OR if provided the instance ID number, skip to number #4.

#2 Read the incident short description

#3 Identify most recent incident and identify EC2 Instance ID from short description that reads "EC2 Instance record i-08e884a3af8f72032is OFF" 

You MUST select the incident record with the most recent date. 

#4 Ask user if the identified EC2 Instance ID is approved. Use the wording "I've identified this as the EC2 Instance ID, would you like me to help remediate his particular number? Please respond with Yes or No".
#4.1 If user responds with No, go back to step #1 to identify any more recent EC2 Incidents and say "Alright, I'll take another look a EC2 Incidents just a minute...." 
#4.2 IF user responds with Yes, proceed with remediation. 

#5 Execute Remediation by using EC2 Instance ID Remediation Helper tool script","sys_id":"43ecb2eda40032107f4413e61b11a1b4","strategy":"f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74"},"task":"Help me resolve incident INC0010020","strategyTopic":"AIA-ReAct"}</metadata><order>200</order><output>{"result":"The incident INC0010020 has been resolved successfully. The EC2 Instance i-08e884a3af8f72032 was restarted as part of the remediation process."}</output><parent/><status>success</status><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-23 11:45:12</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>13216793838032107f44168c50da1e7f</sys_id><sys_mod_count>2</sys_mod_count><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-23 11:47:36</sys_updated_on><target_document_id>43ecb2eda40032107f4413e61b11a1b4</target_document_id><target_document_table>sn_aia_agent</target_document_table><task_dependencies/><type>agent</type></sn_aia_execution_task></record_update>

The user has approved the remediation of the identified EC2 Instance ID. According to the predefined directives, the next step is to execute the remediation using the EC2 Instance ID Remediation Helper tool.\",\"Action\":{\"Action Reason\":\"The user has approved the remediation of the EC2 Instance ID. I will use the EC2 Instance ID Remediation Helper tool to execute the remediation.\",\"Name\":\"EC2 Instance ID Remediation Helper\"},\"Action Inputs\":{\"instance_id\":{\"Action Input Reason\":\"The instance ID i-08e884a3af8f72032 is the one provided in the mission and approved by the user for remediation.\",\"Value\":\"i-08e884a3af8f72032\"}},\"URL\":\"/sys_gen_ai_log_metadata.do?sys_id=85d997d7834032107f44168c50da1e61\",\"Time\":\"11097\"}"}</output><parent display_value="Created 2025-09-23 11:12:33">81b957d7834032107f44168c50da1e94</parent><status>success</status><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-23 11:12:55</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>dec9d7d7834032107f44168c50da1e3b</sys_id><sys_mod_count>1</sys_mod_count><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-23 11:13:07</sys_updated_on><target_document_id>undefined</target_document_id><target_document_table>undefined</target_document_table><task_dependencies/><type>gen_ai</type></sn_aia_execution_task></record_update>

The user has approved the identified EC2 Instance ID for remediation. According to the predefined directives, the next step is to execute remediation using the EC2 Instance ID Remediation Helper tool.\",\"Action\":{\"Action Reason\":\"The 'EC2 Instance ID Remediation Helper' tool is appropriate for executing remediation on the identified EC2 Instance ID, which aligns with step #5 of the predefined directives.\",\"Name\":\"EC2 Instance ID Remediation Helper\"},\"Action Inputs\":{\"instance_id\":{\"Action Input Reason\":\"The EC2 Instance ID i-08e884a3af8f72032 was identified from the incident record and approved by the user for remediation.\",\"Value\":\"i-08e884a3af8f72032\"}},\"URL\":\"/sys_gen_ai_log_metadata.do?sys_id=5f9163d3838032107f44168c50da1e71\",\"Time\":\"9085\"}"}</output><parent display_value="Created 2025-09-23 11:45:12">13216793838032107f44168c50da1e7f</parent><status>success</status><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-23 11:46:58</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>899123d3838032107f44168c50da1e6d</sys_id><sys_mod_count>1</sys_mod_count><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-23 11:47:07</sys_updated_on><target_document_id>undefined</target_document_id><target_document_table>undefined</target_document_table><task_dependencies/><type>gen_ai</type></sn_aia_execution_task></record_update>

According to the predefined directives, since the instance ID is already provided, I can skip directly to step #4, which involves asking the user for approval to remediate the identified EC2 Instance ID.\",\"Action\":{\"Action Reason\":\"I need to ask the user for approval to remediate the identified EC2 Instance ID. Since no tool is available for this task, I will use the FALLBACK action to collect input from the user.\",\"Name\":\"FALLBACK\"},\"Action Inputs\":{\"mode\":{\"Action Input Reason\":\"I need to ask the user for approval to remediate the identified EC2 Instance ID.\",\"Value\":\"collect_input_from_user\"},\"prompt\":{\"Action Input Reason\":\"I need to ask the user for approval to remediate the identified EC2 Instance ID.\",\"Value\":\"I've identified this as the EC2 Instance ID, would you like me to help remediate this particular number? Please respond with Yes or No.\"},\"internal_external_references\":{\"Action Input Reason\":\"No references are needed as this is a direct query to the user.\",\"Value\":\"{}\"}},\"URL\":\"/sys_gen_ai_log_metadata.do?sys_id=dab95797834032107f44168c50da1e6a\",\"Time\":\"5217\"}"}</output><parent display_value="Created 2025-09-23 11:12:33">81b957d7834032107f44168c50da1e94</parent><status>success</status><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-23 11:12:33</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>4db957d7834032107f44168c50da1e9a</sys_id><sys_mod_count>1</sys_mod_count><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-23 11:12:39</sys_updated_on><target_document_id>undefined</target_document_id><target_document_table>undefined</target_document_table><task_dependencies/><type>gen_ai</type></sn_aia_execution_task></record_update>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_execution_task"><sn_aia_execution_task action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>EC2 Remediation Assistant</description><execution_plan display_value="Created 2025-09-23 11:12:30">58b9d797834032107f44168c50da1eb0</execution_plan><metadata>{"agentDetails":{"name":"EC2 Remediation Assistant","role":"EC2 remediation specialist for DevOps operations. Your role is to be able to read incident descriptions, identify EC2 intance IDs, request human approval, and execute remediation using an API integration.","background":"As an EC2 remediation specialist with the itil role you will follow the following steps:

#1 If provided the {{incident_number}} use the "Look up incident records" too to look up incidents. OR if provided the instance ID number, skip to number #4.

#2 Read the incident short description

#3 Identify most recent incident and identify EC2 Instance ID from short description that reads "EC2 Instance record i-08e884a3af8f72032is OFF" 

You MUST select the incident record with the most recent date. 

#4 Ask user if the identified EC2 Instance ID is approved. Use the wording "I've identified this as the EC2 Instance ID, would you like me to help remediate his particular number? Please respond with Yes or No".
#4.1 If user responds with No, go back to step #1 to identify any more recent EC2 Incidents and say "Alright, I'll take another look a EC2 Incidents just a minute...." 
#4.2 IF user responds with Yes, proceed with remediation. 

#5 Execute Remediation by using EC2 Instance ID Remediation Helper tool script","sys_id":"43ecb2eda40032107f4413e61b11a1b4","strategy":"f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74"},"task":"Restart instance ID i-08e884a3af8f72032","strategyTopic":"AIA-ReAct"}</metadata><order>200</order><output>{"result":"The instance ID i-08e884a3af8f72032 has been successfully restarted as per the user's approval."}</output><parent/><status>success</status><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-23 11:12:33</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>81b957d7834032107f44168c50da1e94</sys_id><sys_mod_count>2</sys_mod_count><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-23 11:13:25</sys_updated_on><target_document_id>43ecb2eda40032107f4413e61b11a1b4</target_document_id><target_document_table>sn_aia_agent</target_document_table><task_dependencies/><type>agent</type></sn_aia_execution_task></record_update>

sys_update_xml.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_execution_task"><sn_aia_execution_task action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>AIA ReAct Engine</description><execution_plan display_value="Created 2025-09-23 11:12:30">58b9d797834032107f44168c50da1eb0</execution_plan><metadata>{}</metadata><order>400</order><output>{"result":"{\"Thought\":\"The mission to restart the instance ID i-08e884a3af8f72032 has been successfully completed. The user approved the remediation, and the instance restart request was sent successfully. All predefined directives have been addressed, and there are no further steps required.\",\"Action\":{\"Action Reason\":\"The instance restart request has been successfully executed, and all predefined directives have been fulfilled. I can now conclude with the FINISH action.\",\"Name\":\"FINISH\"},\"Action Inputs\":{},\"URL\":\"/sys_gen_ai_log_metadata.do?sys_id=e9e95bd7834032107f44168c50da1e2f\",\"Time\":\"6613\",\"Observation\":\"The instance ID i-08e884a3af8f72032 has been successfully restarted as per the user's approval.\"}"}</output><parent display_value="Created 2025-09-23 11:12:33">81b957d7834032107f44168c50da1e94</parent><status>success</status><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-23 11:13:18</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>08e95bd7834032107f44168c50da1e68</sys_id><sys_mod_count>1</sys_mod_count><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-23 11:13:25</sys_updated_on><target_document_id>undefined</target_document_id><target_document_table>undefined</target_document_table><task_dependencies/><type>gen_ai</type></sn_aia_execution_task></record_update>

sys_update_xml.name: sn_aia_agent_43ecb2eda40032107f4413e61b11a1b4
sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_agent"><sn_aia_agent action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>Helps DevOps engineers restart EC2 instances from incident tickets by reading incident descriptions and executing remediation scripts with human approval</description><instructions>As an EC2 remediation specialist with the itil role, providing access to the incident table and data, you will follow the following steps:
#1 If provided the {{incident_number}} use the "Look up incident records" too to look up incidents. OR if provided the instance ID number, skip to number #4.
#2 Read the incident short description
#3 Identify most recent incident and identify EC2 Instance ID from short description that reads "EC2 Instance record i-08e884a3af8f72032is OFF"
You MUST select the incident record with the most recent date.
#4 Ask user if the identified EC2 Instance ID is approved. Use the wording "I've identified this as the EC2 Instance ID, would you like me to help remediate his particular number? Please respond with Yes or No". #4.1 If user responds with No, go back to step #1 to identify any more recent EC2 Incidents and say "Alright, I'll take another look a EC2 Incidents just a minute...." #4.2 IF user responds with Yes, proceed with remediation.
#5 Execute Remediation by using EC2 Instance ID Remediation Helper tool script</instructions><internal_name>global.x_snc_ec2_monito_0.EC2 Remediation Assistant</internal_name><name>EC2 Remediation Assistant</name><proficiency>- The agent is proficient in handling EC2-related incidents within DevOps operations. As an EC2 remediation specialist, the agent can read incident descriptions, identify EC2 instance IDs, and execute remediation tasks. The agent's role also includes having the itil role, which provides access to the incident table and data, ensuring comprehensive incident management capabilities. - The agent can utilize the 'Incident Record Information Retrieval' tool to access and retrieve incident records from the incident table. This tool requires a search profile and query to function effectively, allowing the agent to gather relevant incident information, such as short descriptions, numbers, categories, and caller IDs, to facilitate the identification of EC2 instance IDs. - The agent is equipped with the 'EC2 Instance ID Remediation Helper' tool, which allows for the execution of remediation tasks on EC2 instances. By providing the EC2 Instance ID, the agent can initiate the remediation process, ensuring that identified issues are addressed efficiently. - The agent can employ the 'Look up incident record' tool to search for specific incident records or numbers. This tool uses predefined CRUD input variables to query the incident table, enabling the agent to locate and analyze incidents that may require EC2 remediation. - The agent follows a detailed ACTION PLAN that includes steps such as looking up incident records, reading incident descriptions, identifying EC2 instance IDs, requesting user approval, and executing remediation. This structured approach ensures that the agent can effectively manage and resolve EC2-related incidents.</proficiency><record_type>custom</record_type><role>EC2 remediation specialist for DevOps operations. Your role is to be able to read incident descriptions, identify EC2 instance IDs, request human approval, and execute remediation using an API integration. As a EC2 remediation specialist you also have the itil role, which provides you access to the incident table and data.</role><run_as/><strategy display_value="ReAct">f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74</strategy><sys_class_name>sn_aia_agent</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-17 22:48:34</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>43ecb2eda40032107f4413e61b11a1b4</sys_id><sys_mod_count>26</sys_mod_count><sys_name>EC2 Remediation Assistant</sys_name><sys_package display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation" source="x_snc_ec2_monito_0">177e9a9a833322107f44168c50da1ea9</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation">177e9a9a833322107f44168c50da1ea9</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sn_aia_agent_43ecb2eda40032107f4413e61b11a1b4</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-23 21:24:47</sys_updated_on></sn_aia_agent></record_update>

sys_update_xml.name: sn_aia_execution_task_7f51eb93838032107f44168c50da1e98
sys_update_xml.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_execution_task"><sn_aia_execution_task action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>Incident Record Information Retrieval</description><execution_plan display_value="Created 2025-09-23 11:45:11">7e212f13838032107f44168c50da1e4a</execution_plan><metadata>{"type":"tool","id":"8021ddea2b0d52101d72fb466e91bfd1","name":"Incident Record Information Retrieval","inputs":{"search_profile":"sn_aia_ai_agent_incident_search_profile","query":"INC0010020","sources":["incident"],"search_type":"keyword","fields":["incident.short_description","incident.number","incident.category","incident.caller_id"],"search_results_limit":"5"}}</metadata><order>400</order><output>{"result":"{\"Output\":\"Resolution Steps: \\n 1. Review the incident record INC0010020, which indicates that the EC2 Instance i-08e884a3af8f72032 is OFF as of 2025-09-23 11:24:10.
